uk.ac.macaulay.util
Interface GISRasterImageConverter<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGISRasterImageConverter, GISHSBLogScaledKey, GISHSBScaledKey, GISMappedKey, GISMultiScaleKey, GISRGBLogScaledKey, GISRGBScaledKey, GISScaledKey
public interface GISRasterImageConverter<T>

Interface for converters from an entry in a cell in a GISRaster to a colour to represent that entry, and vice versa.

Author:
Gary Polhill

Method Summary
 java.awt.Color getColor(T entry)
          Return the colour associated with the entry in the cell
 T getEntry(java.awt.Color colour)
          Return the entry associated with the colour (in some cases, this may not return an exact value)
 java.lang.String getFailureMessage()
          The getColor(Object) and getEntry(Color) methods should return null if they cannot find a value.
 

Method Detail

getColor

java.awt.Color getColor(T entry)
Return the colour associated with the entry in the cell

Parameters:
entry - The entry in the cell
Returns:
The colour to represent it

getEntry

T getEntry(java.awt.Color colour)
Return the entry associated with the colour (in some cases, this may not return an exact value)

Parameters:
colour - The colour used to represent an entry
Returns:
The entry associated with the colour

getFailureMessage

java.lang.String getFailureMessage()
The getColor(Object) and getEntry(Color) methods should return null if they cannot find a value. If they do, this method can be used to find out why. It is only guaranteed to have a sensible value if the last call to one of the above methods returned null.

Returns:
The error message associated with the last null value returned from getColor() or getEntry()
